alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... In the author's opinion, the confident announcement of the decisive confirmation of Einstein's general theory in November 1919 was not a triumph of science, as it is often portrayed, but one of the most unfortunate events in the history of 20th-century science."

- Anomalies in the History of Relativity, Ian McCausland, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Toronto
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The 1919 Eclipse as an Unfortunate Event - Part 2
